categories.name: Academic
categories.description:
Education and campus life make up a big part of a student's life. Studying at CY Tech gave me a lot of creative opportunities for projects and tools that can improve student life.

The following repos are both academic projects and personal initiatives for improving campus life.

projects.title: ILoveJava
projects.description:
A Java dedicated forum built with Spring Boot, Spring Security, Spring Data JPA and tailwindcss.

Powered by markdown-it and PrismJS, it features full rich text formatting support and intelligent code highlighting.

It has been designed as the final project for our Java EE course, by a group of 3 students. The main goal was to create a forum with a modern design, while following the MVC pattern.

projects.title: Efficien-CY
projects.description:
A web app that helps students find a quiet empty place on campus, also known as Find A Room.

It features a simple and clean design, and a documented REST API. It is powered by koa, tailwindcss and redoc, while using scraped events from student's timetables as data source.

The ease of use, together with the simple powerful API makes it a great tool and an easy integration, not only for students, but also for teachers and staff.

projects.title: ARPIÆ Website
projects.description:
The official website for the ARPIÆ association, CYTech's "Junior Entreprise", built by me and another student during my time as a member of the board (SysAdmin).

Featuring a pure look and a minimalistic design, it is a simple one-page display website powered by tailwindcss

projects.title: CY Bot
projects.description:
Discord bot that automatically updates the new timetables for selected classes to dedicated channels.

Updating every 10 minutes, it is a great tool for students to keep track of their classes. Actively used by dozens of people, it is often the go-to solution for fast and easy peaking at the upcoming events.

It is built with discord.js and uses an old command handling system, but an update is planned in a near future.

projects.title: EISTI-Celcat
projects.description:
Node.JS utility script that scrapes EISTI's (CY Tech) Celcat calendars and exports them to .ics files.

It is a simple script that can be used to integrate the calendars with other apps, Efficien-CY and other utilities depend on it.

While being the first scrapper for EISTI's Celcat, it is not the most efficient one, nor the most popular one. It is however still maintained and used by some people.

projects.title: FRE
projects.description:
Free Real Estate,

while the name can be a little pretentious, FRE was a free PHP hosting service for students, taking advantage of docker containers.

The hardware, the software and the support were all provided by me and another student, making this project a great learning experience and an exciting technical challenge to overcome.

All "clients" were provided with a subdomain, an apache server with PHP support, a code-server instance, a MySQL database and access to a file manager app.

Everything ran in docker containers, on a server hosted in my living room, right next to my couch. It was a great experience : a fully functional hosting service, for free, for students.

categories.name: Entertainment
categories.description: Those are the projects I work on solely because I can. Some of them might respond to a very specific temporary problem. Most of them are the product of me wondering if I can make them, instead of wondering if I should.

projects.title: Spotify Canvas Visualizer
projects.description:
React web application tracking your Spotify activity to show Canvas visuals.

The canvas themselves are queried from Spotify's unofficial API, the currently playing status is gathered with the official one and are issued by the browser itself.

While the utility of this project isn't obvious, it has served multiple sets and parties.

projects.title: Enigma
projects.description:
Enigma is an online treasure hunt community that I have founded back in 2017. While puzzle releases have become a rare event due to the amount of time and creativity required for each one of them, some projects are still in the works.

Over the years, we have engineered dozens of complex treasure hunts under different forms, the majority being Web Applications but also Android Apps and CTFs.

Knowledge of basic cryptography, stenography and sometimes OSINT is required for solving our puzzles.

projects.title: Untold Radio
projects.description:
Untold is a romanian EDM festival taking place in Cluj. This project was about retrieving the radio feed of the Untold application and embedding it in a basic Discord bot.

Built with Discord.js, a public version of the bot is maintained.

projects.title: Shitposta : Meme library delivery
projects.description:
Shitposta is a very basic media viewer and database. Designed to be a simple web interface playing random videos and content, it is a Node.JS web application indexing media files to a SQLite database and allowing easy acces to them.

The project's name derived from the type of content it was designed to serve : memes

categories.name: Utilities
categories.description:
This is the stuff you will mainly find on my GitHub : code that could make your life easier.

As most of the developers out there, I hate doing repetitive tasks. Programming is like a cake and automation is the cherry on top : you can never have too much cake (not a medical advice).

The following repos got a little bit of love from people around the world, they're far from popular but I felt like they deserve a mention.

projects.title: DJI SRT Parser
projects.description:
A simple python script that takes DJI-drone taken video files as an entry then extracts flight metadata and offers basic summaries for the different measurements.

Tested with DJI FPV footage, it should be compatible with other DJI models.

projects.title: Executionner
projects.description: A Discord.js terminal emulator, supporting real-time output. Executionner allows turning a Discord channel in an easy-to-access shell, use at your own risk (;

projects.title: TestFlight watcher
projects.description:
Basic Discord webhook for scraping iOS TestFlight application programs for availability.

Built with Node.JS, the script queries all the selected links and sends a message to your dedicated Discord channel whenever joining is an option.

This project has been used by quite some people, which was a pleasant surprise.
